body:
```
53    D100 Missing docstring in public module
21    D101 Missing docstring in public class
95    D102 Missing docstring in public method
44    D103 Missing docstring in public function
13    D104 Missing docstring in public package
57    D105 Missing docstring in magic method
40    D107 Missing docstring in __init__
28    D200 One-line docstring should fit on one line with quotes
3     D202 No blank lines allowed after function docstring
97    D205 1 blank line required between summary line and description
6     D208 Docstring is over-indented
1     D209 Multi-line docstring closing quotes should be on a separate line
171   D400 First line should end with a period
48    D401 First line should be in imperative mood
677
```
We have quite a ways to go here.
For v0.3.0, we just need docstrings for our API. We will not enforce it with flake8-docstrings yet.

issue.title: Add docs for public API

labels.name: clean-up
labels.description: Cleaning up the code or refactoring

repository.name: fonduer
repository.description: A knowledge base construction engine for richly formatted data

issue.body:
## Description
In this PR, we want to add docs for all of the user API, shown in https://fonduer.readthedocs.io/en/docstrings/ (see #66). 

We also want to remove any unused methods.

## Details
Because this will be the public API, we want these docstrings to be as complete as possible. See[ this reference](https://thomas-cokelaer.info/tutorials/sphinx/docstring_python.html) for best practices in documentation:

For parameters, types, return, and return types
```
:param arg1: description
:param arg2: description
:type arg1: type description
:type arg1: type description
:return: return description
:rtype: the return type description
```

For examples:

```
:Example:

    example.parse_file()

followed by a blank line !
```

For special sections:

```
.. seealso:: blabla
.. warnings also:: blabla
.. note:: blabla
.. todo:: blabla
```

For documenting class attributes/properties:

```py
class Foo():
"""Docstring for Foo."""

    #: Docstring for attribute x
    x = 0

```


Test locally before committing:

```
make docs
```
and open `_build/html/index.html` in a browser.


## TODO
- [x] Parsing
- [x] Data Model Utilities
- [x] Candidate Extractionr
- [x] Multimodal Featurization
- [x] Supervision
- [x] Learning

body:
Can you reopen this as ultimately I'd like Fonduer to be enforced by flake8-docstrings?
How about enforcing just for APIs for now? (I don't know how to narrow the check scope, though).

If we can't narrow the check scope to APIs, we can check docstrings for everything and ignore violations at this moment.
Preferably, the number of violations would better be monitored like Coveralls does for test coverage to motivate us to write docstrings.

issue.title: Add a docstring guideline

repository.name: fonduer
repository.description: A knowledge base construction engine for richly formatted data

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

It'd be good to have a guideline for what the docstring should look like.
The following is my work-in-progress guideline

```
Docstring format
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

We use Sphinx as our Docstring format.
According to Sphinx, `:type` and `:rtype` are optional, but are not allowed in Fonduer.
docstring should look like as follows:

.. code-block:: python

    from typing import Union

    def format_unit(value: Union[float, int], unit: str) -> str:
        """Format the given value as a human readable string using the given units.

        :param value: a numeric value
        :param unit: the unit for the value (kg, m, etc.)
        :return: a human readable string using the given units
        """
        return '{} {}'.format(value, unit)
```

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Add a section like above to `docs/dev/codestyle.rst`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Use docstring style checker that can check our format.
There are nice docstring checkers like pydocstyle (this can be used via flake8-docstrings), but I don't think they can check a docstring in such a detail (e.g., check if :type exists).

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

This is related to #422 and #66.

issue.title: Remove redundant ":type" and ":rtype" information from the docstring

repository.name: fonduer
repository.description: A knowledge base construction engine for richly formatted data

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

See https://github.com/HazyResearch/fonduer/pull/421#issuecomment-631587136.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Remove redundant ":type" and ":rtype" information from the docstring

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

N/A.

**Additional context**

Now Fonduer has type hints in the method definition, which makes ":type" and ":rtype" in docstring redundant.
